replies.bodyText: As far as I know, calling addAllXXX() method with an empty list is equivalent to not setting that field in protobuf. There isn't a real null semantics in protos. Empty collections or strings are not sent out in wire and getters return at least an empty collection/string even if the field is not set.
replies.author: voidzcy

replies.bodyText: I examine the code. addAll(emptyList) has side effect of setting the internal collection to ArrayList instead of Collections.emptyList(). usually emptyList can cause more problems...
